Package harrygpotter.tombola.tombolalib

Interface ISetFactory

All Superinterfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
All Known Implementing Classes:
TAbstractSetFactory, TProgressiveSetFactory, TSimpleSetFactory
public interface ISetFactory
extends java.lang.Runnable
This is the common interface implemented by all Set of Series generation algorithm classes included in the TombolaLib library. All generation algorithm classes have methods to set the desired number of series, the maximum tolerable amount of equal number between cards and between rows of cards. ISetFactory implementing objects have also been designed in order to run the series generation process in a dedicated thread and therefore encapsulate method to start, check status and stop these 'executor' threads.
Since:
1.8
Version:
1.1
Author:
Harry G. Potter (harry[.]g[.]potter[@]gmail[.]com)
See Also:
TAbstractSetFactory

    Nested Classes 
    Modifier and Type Interface Description
    static class  ISetFactory.TStatus
    Enum definition used to maintain the status of the generation algorithm

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    static long MAX_ITERATIONS
    Considering the heuristic nature of many the generation algorithms, a guard limit is used to prevent the (very very unlikely) possibility that the generation method runs indefinitely. This value is the limit to the number of total iterations a generation process can do.
    static long MAX_ITERATIONS_MILLISECS
    Considering the heuristic nature of many the generation algorithms, a guard limit is used to prevent the (very very unlikely) possibility that the generation method runs indefinitely. This value is the limit to the elapsed time a generation process can run.
    static int MINIMUM_MAXEPC
    Set the minimum value allowed for the "max equal number between cards" parameter used when checking the quality of a set of series.
    static int MINIMUM_MAXEPR
    Set the minimum value allowed for the "max equal number between rows" parameter used when checking the quality of a set of series.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    int getDesideredSeries()
    Return the number of series, each composed by six cards, that have been configured to by generated by the factory.
    long getElapsedMillisecs()
    Return the elapsed time in milliseconds from the start of the generation process to now.
    long getIterationsLimit()
    Return the max number of single iterations allowed to complete the card generation.
    ILogger getLogger()
    Return the current ILogger object used by the factory to communicate progresses and errors during the card generation process.
    int getMaxEqualPerCard()
    Return the value of the parameter set to specify the max equal number allowed per card.
    int getMaxEqualPerRow()
    Return the max equal number allowed per row.
    java.lang.String getMethodName()
    Each class implementing this interface must return a human readable name for the algorithm it uses in order to generate the set of series.
    TMakeSix getSeriesBuilder()
    Return the TMakeSix object used by the set factory to generate each series of cards.
    TSeriesList getSeriesList()
    Return the List object containing the generated series of cards.
    ISetFactory.TStatus getStatus()
    Return the current status of the factory object.
    long getTimeLimit()
    Return the timeout, in milliseconds, set in order to complete the card generation.
    void joinOnEnded()
    Invoke this method to block your execution and wait until the series generation process ends.
    void joinOnEnded​(long mSecsTimeout)
    Invoke this method to block your execution and wait until either the series generation process ends or the timeout in milliseconds passed as input parameter is reached.
    void requestStart()
    Invoke this method to start the generation process after you set all parameters/components needed (setDesiredSeries, setSeriesBuilder, setLogger, etc.). When invoked, the factory status changes from READY to RUNNING.
    void requestStop()
    Invoke this method to stop the generation process (i.e. force an interruption). When invoked, the status change from RUNNING to STOPPED
    void setDesiredSeries​(int desiredSeries)
    While in the "INITIALIZING" status, user should set the number of desired series of card the algorithms has to generate.
    void setIterationsLimit​(long iterationsLimit)
    Set a limit to the number of series generation that can be tried during the set creation.
    void setLogger​(ILogger logger)
    Set the logger object that the factory will use to trace its activities and "communicate" to the externals. It MUST be set during the INITALIZATION phase and cannot be changed during the following phases of the generation process.
    void setMaxEqualPerCard​(int maxEPC)
    While in the "INITIALITING" status, set the maximum value allowed for equal number between cards.
    void setMaxEqualPerRow​(int maxEPR)
    While in the "INITIALITING" status, set the maximum value allowed for equal number between row of different cards.
    void setSeriesBuilder​(TMakeSix seriesBuilder)
    While in the "INITIALIZING" status, user should set the TMakeSix instance the series ser factory will use to generate each single series.
    void setSeriesList​(TSeriesList runningSet)
    While in the "INITIALITING" status, could set an initial list of TSeries instances the generation algorithm will start from.
    void setTimeLimit​(long limitMilliSecs)
    Set the timeout limit in milliseconds for the generation process.

  • Method Details

    • getMethodName

      java.lang.String getMethodName()
      Each class implementing this interface must return a human readable name for the algorithm it uses in order to generate the set of series.
      Returns:
      a descriptive name for the specific series generation algorithm used by the class.

    • getStatus

      ISetFactory.TStatus getStatus()
      Return the current status of the factory object. Here a brief description of the intended meaning of each state follows:
      • status == INITIALIZING: there are still mandatory parameters and or component objects to be set;
      • status == READY: everything has been done in order to start the series generation;
      • status == RUNNING: algorithm is running, series are going to be generated;
      • status == STOPPING: the interruption of the process has been requested but the executor thread is still finalizing its things in order to definitively stop;
      • status == STOPPED: generation process has been forcedly interrupted. Desired number of series may have been not completely generated yet. Typically process can be also re-started;
      • status == COMPLETED: the process has naturally completed its execution. Desired series have been generated respecting MaxEPC/MaxEPR configured values.
      Returns:
      the current status of the factory object

    • setDesiredSeries

      void setDesiredSeries​(int desiredSeries)
      While in the "INITIALIZING" status, user should set the number of desired series of card the algorithms has to generate. the value must be greater than 1 and lesser then TUtils.MAX_SERIES.
      Parameters:
      desiredSeries - the number of series you want to generate.

    • getDesideredSeries

      int getDesideredSeries()
      Return the number of series, each composed by six cards, that have been configured to by generated by the factory.
      Returns:
      the number of series to be produced by the factory.

    • setSeriesBuilder

      void setSeriesBuilder​(TMakeSix seriesBuilder)
      While in the "INITIALIZING" status, user should set the TMakeSix instance the series ser factory will use to generate each single series.
      Parameters:
      seriesBuilder - the TMakeSix object the factory object will use.

    • getSeriesBuilder

      TMakeSix getSeriesBuilder()
      Return the TMakeSix object used by the set factory to generate each series of cards.
      Returns:
      the TMakeSix object used by the set factory to generate each series of cards.

    • setSeriesList

      void setSeriesList​(TSeriesList runningSet)
      While in the "INITIALITING" status, could set an initial list of TSeries instances the generation algorithm will start from. Depending on the specific implementation of the generation algorithm, empty or non empty set are allowed.
      Parameters:
      runningSet - the set of series of cards you want start from to continue with series generation

    • getSeriesList

      TSeriesList getSeriesList()
      Return the List object containing the generated series of cards.
      Returns:
      the List object containing the generated series of cards.

    • setMaxEqualPerCard

      void setMaxEqualPerCard​(int maxEPC)
      While in the "INITIALITING" status, set the maximum value allowed for equal number between cards. Typically if this value is exceeded by a couple of cards during the generation process, the series containing one of them is discarded and regenerated.
      Parameters:
      maxEPC - the maximum equal number per card allowed during card comparison

    • getMaxEqualPerCard

      int getMaxEqualPerCard()
      Return the value of the parameter set to specify the max equal number allowed per card.
      Returns:
      the max equal number allowed per card.

    • setMaxEqualPerRow

      void setMaxEqualPerRow​(int maxEPR)
      While in the "INITIALITING" status, set the maximum value allowed for equal number between row of different cards. Typically if this value is exceeded by a couple of rows during the generation process, the series containing the card with one of the exceeding row is discarded and regenerated.
      Parameters:
      maxEPR - the maximum equal number per row allowed during card comparison

    • getMaxEqualPerRow

      int getMaxEqualPerRow()
      Return the max equal number allowed per row.
      Returns:
      the max equal number allowed per row.

    • setTimeLimit

      void setTimeLimit​(long limitMilliSecs)
      Set the timeout limit in milliseconds for the generation process. It is used to set an execution limit to the generation process in case the desired parameters of maxEPC and/or maxEPR are too challenging. The parameter should be set when the object is in the INITIALIZING phase, but it can be changed even during the following phases.
      Parameters:
      limitMilliSecs - the desired timeout, expressed in milliseconds

    • getTimeLimit

      long getTimeLimit()
      Return the timeout, in milliseconds, set in order to complete the card generation.
      Returns:
      the timeout, in milliseconds, set in order to complete the card generation.

    • setIterationsLimit

      void setIterationsLimit​(long iterationsLimit)
      Set a limit to the number of series generation that can be tried during the set creation. It is used to set an execution limit to the generation process in case the desired parameters of maxEPC and/or maxEPR are too challenging (impossible to meet). The parameter should be set when the object is in the INITIALIZING phase, but it can be changed even during the following phases. It limit the number of series of 6 cards.
      Parameters:
      iterationsLimit - the maximum number of series of cards that can be generated/discarding during the set generation process.

    • getIterationsLimit

      long getIterationsLimit()
      Return the max number of single iterations allowed to complete the card generation.
      Returns:
      the max number of single iterations allowed to complete the card generation.

    • getElapsedMillisecs

      long getElapsedMillisecs()
      Return the elapsed time in milliseconds from the start of the generation process to now.
      Returns:
      the elapsed time in milliseconds from the start of the generation process to now.

    • setLogger

      void setLogger​(ILogger logger)
      Set the logger object that the factory will use to trace its activities and "communicate" to the externals. It MUST be set during the INITALIZATION phase and cannot be changed during the following phases of the generation process.
      Parameters:
      logger - the logger that the factory will use to trace its activities
      See Also:
      ILogger

    • getLogger

      ILogger getLogger()
      Return the current ILogger object used by the factory to communicate progresses and errors during the card generation process.
      Returns:
      the current ILogger object used by the factory

    • requestStart

      void requestStart()
      Invoke this method to start the generation process after you set all parameters/components needed (setDesiredSeries, setSeriesBuilder, setLogger, etc.). When invoked, the factory status changes from READY to RUNNING.

    • requestStop

      void requestStop()
      Invoke this method to stop the generation process (i.e. force an interruption). When invoked, the status change from RUNNING to STOPPED

    • joinOnEnded

      void joinOnEnded() throws java.lang.InterruptedException
      Invoke this method to block your execution and wait until the series generation process ends. It should work in the same way as the Java standard library method Thread#join() works.
      Throws:
      java.lang.InterruptedException - as thrown by Thread.join() method

    • joinOnEnded

      void joinOnEnded​(long mSecsTimeout) throws java.lang.InterruptedException
      Invoke this method to block your execution and wait until either the series generation process ends or the timeout in milliseconds passed as input parameter is reached. It should work in the same way as the Java standard library method Thread#join(long) works.
      Parameters:
      mSecsTimeout - time in milliseconds to wait before retake control
      Throws:
      java.lang.InterruptedException - as thrown by Thread.join(long) method
